secondch.description:
Getting used to controling the DJI Phantom 2  with Zenmuse H3-3D Gimbal and GoPro Hero 3+. Out of the box, the drone does not allow for remote video monitoring or flight data transmission, so on this first run it was kept to low altitudes. The unit was later modified to support this functionality in flying high over and along the Harvard Depository.
Music: Fell Out of the Sky by State Shirt.
secondch.location: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/97278374?color=f2020a&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="492" height="277" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

secondch.description: Winter sunrise timelapse captured from a GoPro outside the Harvard Depository with realtime sounds of the surrounding woods recorded by Peter McMurray. The audible creaks are from the tree trunks bending in the early morning winds.
secondch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/rCxYoA60Xcw?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

secondch.description: Shot on an iPhone 5s.
secondch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/t70Q7EOJB9g?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

secondch.itemtitle: Bridging the Border - Transferring HD Materials
secondch.description: Allison Goffman explores the threshold at which items enter the Harvard Depository.
secondch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Y8jd6zBFgCA?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

secondch.description: The music used for the external approach to the French National Library was slowed and modified to underscore the differences of the external approach to the Harvard Depository.
secondch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/i0RVSZ_yDjs?start=161&end=215rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

secondch.description: "The roof is also constructed of nonflammable material and the site has been clearcut around its perimeter to avoid the dangers of a forest fire.”
secondch.location:
<iframe width=“492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jbaWD0t0v1k
?start=661&end=670rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

secondch.description: “Situated 25 miles west of Cambridge on the 160 acre Southborough Campus of Harvard University, The Harvard Depository represents an entirely new type of library building. The capital costs of construction are essentially one dollar per volume. The modular design of the facility will allow for up to ten units to be constructed with each unit capable of storing over two million volumes."
secondch.location:
<iframe width=“492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jbaWD0t0v1k
?start=106&end=130rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

secondch.description: “Each business day, Depository couriers pick up material for transfer from client libraries to the Depository. Clients are responsible for barcoding all material to be transferred and for linking the barcode to their own bibliographic or descriptive record."
secondch.location:
<iframe width=“492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jbaWD0t0v1k
?start=161&end=215rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

secondch.description: “Generally, all orders received by 3:30 in the afternoon are delivered by the morning of the next business day. Materials travel in a temperature-controlled, alarmed, and locked van."
secondch.location:
<iframe width=“492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jbaWD0t0v1k
?start=364&end=374rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
